title: [Effect of melaxen and valdoxan on free radical processes intensity, aconitate hydratase activity and citrate content in rats tissues under hyperthyroidism].
abstract: Issledovano vliianie melaksena i val'doksana na parametry biokhemiliuminestsentsii, aktivnost' akonitatgidratazy i uroven' tsitrata v serdtse i pecheni krys na fone razvitiia éksperimental'nogo gipertireoza. Pri vvedenii dannykh preparatov v tkaniakh krys proiskhodilo snizhenie parametrov biokhemiliuminestsentsii, vozrastaiushchikh v otvet na razvitie oksidativnogo stressa pri gipertireoze. Aktivnost' akonitatgidratazy i kontsentratsiia tsitrata, uvelichivaiushchiesia v usloviiakh patologii v pecheni i serdtse krys, izmenialis' v storonu kontrol'nykh znacheni? pri vvedenii preparatov, korrigiruiushchikh uroven' melatonina. Poluchennye rezul'taty ukazyvaiut na pozitivnoe de?stvie melaksena i val'doksana na oksidativny? status organizma pri razvitii éksperimental'nogo gipertireoza, chto, ochevidno, sopriazheno s antioksidantnym de?stviem melatonina, povyshenie urovnia kotorgo proiskhodit pod vliianiem étikh preparatov.The influence of melaxen and valdoxan on the biochemiluminescence parameters, aconitate hydratase activity and citrate level in rats heart and liver during development of experimental hyperthyroidism has been investigated. Administration of these substances promoted a decrease of biochemiluminescence parameters, which had been increased in tissues of rats in response to the development of oxidative stress under hyperthyroidism. Aconitate hydratase activity and citrate concentration in rats liver and heart, growing at pathological conditions, changed towards control value after administration of the drugs correcting melatonin level. The results indicate the positive effect of valdoxan and melaxen on oxidative status of the organism under the development of experimental hyperthyroidism that is associated with antioxidant action of melatonin.
